title: Intro to Copyright Law
subject: Copyright law basics
description: This quiz covers the fundamental concepts of copyright law, including what can be copyrighted, the rights of copyright holders, exceptions, and the basics of infringement and fair use.

questions.text: What is the primary purpose of copyright law?

answers.text: To protect original works of authorship
To regulate patents and trademarks
To control all forms of property
To prevent all copying of ideas

questions.text: Which of the following can be protected by copyright?

answers.text: A novel
An idea for a story
A mathematical formula
A government document

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a requirement for a work to be copyrighted?

answers.text: It must be original
It must be fixed in a tangible medium
It must be registered with the government
It must show some minimal creativity

questions.text: Who is generally considered the copyright owner of a work?

answers.text: The person who created the work
Anyone who finds the work
The first person to publish the work
The government

questions.text: Which of the following is an exclusive right granted to copyright holders?

answers.text: The right to reproduce the work
The right to patent the work
The right to trademark the work
The right to seize copies from others

questions.text: How long does copyright protection generally last for works created after 1977 in the U.S.?

answers.text: The life of the author plus 70 years
20 years from creation
Forever
10 years from publication

questions.text: Which of the following is an example of fair use?

answers.text: Quoting a short passage in a book review
Copying an entire book for a friend
Selling unauthorized copies of a movie
Posting a full song online without permission

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a factor considered in determining fair use?

answers.text: The purpose and character of the use
The amount and substantiality of the portion used
The popularity of the work
The effect of the use on the market for the original
Using a copyrighted work without permission in a way that violates the copyright holder's rights
Creating a new work inspired by another
Registering a copyright
Citing a source in a research paper

questions.text: Which of the following is a possible consequence of copyright infringement?

answers.text: Paying monetary damages
Receiving a patent
Automatic ownership of the work
Exemption from all copyright laws
